results.title: The Vice President
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
Elevation to the position of Vice-President brings prestige responsibility and freedoms of action, but it also means a shifting of loyalties and the losing of personal contact. This is shown in the dramatised story of John Harvard who rising from Branch Director to Vice-President finds himself having to put pressure on the men who a short time ago were his near equals. Only by going against their wishes can he serve the best interests of his company.

results.title: The VFL 1st semi final: [Richmond vs Geelong 1969]
results.brief_description: First semi final 1969, Richmond vs Geelong. Film shows third and fourth quarters at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with final scores Richmond 25 goals 17 behinds 167 points defeating Geelong 7 goals 7 behinds 49 points.

results.title: The Very last thing from Pandora's Box
results.brief_description:
Beautifully drawn and coloured animation ponders human existence - the misery and fleetingness of life and its solace, hope.
This work was produced as part of AIM (Centre for Animation and interactive Media), RMIT, 2003.

results.title: The Very hungry caterpillar and other stories = The World of Eric Carle
results.creator_credit: Iain Harvey, Illuminated Film Company, Scholastic Productions and Andrew Goff
results.brief_description: Five animated stories from famous children’s author Eric Carle. In “The Very hungry caterpillar,” a caterpillar born on a Sunday eats a little more each day of the week but never seems to have his appetite satisfied. Until next Sunday that is, when he builds himself a cocoon. “Papa, please get the moon for me”: Before she goes to bed, little Monica looks out the window and spies the moon, longing to play with it, but try as she might, she can’t reach it, and asks her papa for help. “The Very quiet cricket”: A baby cricket struggles to answer the call of other insects; when he rubs his legs together there’s no sound. “The Mixed-up chameleon”: An unhappy chameleon, unsure of what he wants to be, seeks inspiration from creatures at the zoo. “I See a song”: A violinist plays notes that manifest themselves as a morphing array of colours, shapes and images. Stories narrated by Roger McGough and Juliet Stevenson. Music by Julian Nott.

results.title: The Very best of Peter Sellers
results.creator_credit: Robert Sidaway and MCEG Virgin Vision
results.brief_description: Everyone has a favourite moment from the many films of Peter Sellers. Reacall many moments from the classic Pink Panther films, where Sellers protrays his most celebrated character - that of the incompetent Inspector Clouseau. See rare footage and Goon-like antics with Spike Milligan. All these moments and many more, captured in almost one-hour of non-stop entertainment, showing the screen’s finest clown at his most brilliant and comic best.

results.title: The Very best of Fast Forward
results.brief_description: Comedy troupes come and go, but in Australia one conglomeration has had them rolling in the aisles longer than any other. The team of Fast Forward have become an institution in this country, making a television career out of sending up TV. The brilliant talents of the writers and comedians take the mickey out of the serials, the ads, the soap operas, the video clips - the things we see day in day out on the small screen. Relive such classics as Magda Szubanski in the Sorbent ads, Marg Downeys Jana Wendt, Michelle and Ferret, the Dodgy Brothers, Victor and Sveta (the Russian Newscasters), Bobby Batista (the visually-impaired American newscaster) and Gina Riley imitating a bunch of pop musicians in well-known video clips.
